title: How to Wear a Dress Shirt

steps.title: Pick out a polished dress shirt and a nice pair of dress pants.
steps.content: Pick out a polished dress shirt and a nice pair of dress pants. Then, add a dash of color to your ensemble with a necktie. As an extra formal touch, slip a vest over your tie and dress shirt—or, you can skip the vest and finish off your outfit with a suit jacket. [1] X Research source Solid dress shirts provide a nice background for patterned suits, while patterned dress shirts add an extra dimension to solid-colored suits.

steps.title: Always wear a tie with dress shirts that have point collars.
steps.content: Always wear a tie with dress shirts that have point collars. Other styles, like the spread collar, offer a bit more wiggle room. Keep your tie centered with your dress shirt for a polished, professional look. [2] X Research source In some outfit combinations, you may tuck your tie into a suit jacket or vest.

steps.title: Dress shirts and trousers fit into the “smart casual” and “dressy casual” categories.
steps.content: Dress shirts and trousers fit into the “smart casual” and “dressy casual” categories. Dress for a smart casual event with a pair of nice trousers, a dress shirt, and loafers. For dressy casual events, wear your dress and trousers with a sport coat, along with loafers or slip-ons. You don’t need to wear a tie with these outfits.

steps.title: Leave your dress shirt untucked with the top 2 buttons undone.
steps.content: Leave your dress shirt untucked with the top 2 buttons undone. Layer your shirt over a pair of jeans or slim-cut pants, and slip on a blazer or suit jacket overtop. Leave the jacket unbuttoned to finish off your loose, relaxed outfit. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Jeans provide a relaxed, casual contrast to your dress shirt.
steps.content: Jeans provide a relaxed, casual contrast to your dress shirt. Slip into your favorite pair, layering an untucked dress shirt over top. As a finishing touch, put on your favorite pair of tennis shoes. [4] X Research source You could wear a dark dress shirt with a light pair of jeans, along with some white sneakers.

steps.title: Pick out a sleek, knee-length pair of shorts.
steps.content: Pick out a sleek, knee-length pair of shorts. Tuck your shirt into your shorts for a more polished, professional look. If you’d prefer a more relaxed outfit, leave your shirt untucked over your waistband. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Slip on your dress shirt, which will act as the base of your outfit.
steps.content: Slip on your dress shirt, which will act as the base of your outfit. Then, add a sweater over top. Make sure the ends of your shirt cuffs, as well as your shirt collar, are visible beneath the sweater. [6] X Research source You might pair your dress shirt and sweater with some nice jeans and a set of sneakers.

steps.title: Keep the lower cuff button secure, but undo the topmost button.
steps.content: Keep the lower cuff button secure, but undo the topmost button. Roll your sleeve up to the middle of your forearm, creating a sleek look. For a more relaxed look, undo both cuff buttons before rolling up your sleeve. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Check if your cuffs have 1 or 2 buttons.
steps.content: Check if your cuffs have 1 or 2 buttons. If you find 2 buttons, use the loosest option on your bare arm. If you’re wearing a watch, pick the tighter button option, which puts your timepiece on full display. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Let your shirttails dangle over the top of your pants.
steps.content: Let your shirttails dangle over the top of your pants. Don’t worry! An untucked shirt can still add a chic touch to your outfit. [9] X Research source For example, you might layer an untucked dress shirt over a nice pair of pants, with an unbuttoned jacket layered over top.

steps.title: The military tuck is a simple, effective way to tuck in your shirt.
steps.content: The military tuck is a simple, effective way to tuck in your shirt. Unbutton and unzip your pants, so you have a little wiggle room to work with. Tuck your shirt into your waistband and zip up your pants, leaving the button undone. Then, pinch any extra material along the sides of your dress shirt and fold it toward your hip into a pleat. At this point, re-button your pants and adjust the belt as needed. [10] X Research source Try the underwear tuck if you’re wearing layers. With this style, tuck your undershirt into your underwear, and layer your dress shirt over top. Then, pull your pants on and tuck in your shirt. You can also use shirt stays, or shirt garters, to hold your dress shirt in place.

steps.title: Leave the top 3 buttons undone on your shirt.
steps.content: Leave the top 3 buttons undone on your shirt. Then, let your undershirt peek out over your unbuttoned top—this gives off a light, relaxed look. [11] X Research source

steps.title: White dress shirts are a safe option for most outfits.
steps.content: White dress shirts are a safe option for most outfits. You can also change things up with a solid blue shirt, or by delving into pastel colors like pink and lavender. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Recreate a classic look with a striped dress shirt.
steps.content: Recreate a classic look with a striped dress shirt. This garment works great when paired with solid suits. For a more casual look, venture into the realm of checked shirts. [13] X Research source Never mix patterns within a single outfit. If your suit jacket is patterned, stick to a solid-colored dress shirt.

steps.title: Loafers are a great option for a casual outfit.
steps.content: Loafers are a great option for a casual outfit. [14] X Research source Other slip-on shoes, like moccasins or boat shoes, can give your outfit a relaxed vibe. [15] X Research source Pick out a pair of dress shoes if you’re getting dressed to the nines. [16] X Research source

steps.title: A point collar elongates your face, and a spread collar widens it.
steps.content: A point collar elongates your face, and a spread collar widens it. Point collars tend to guide the eye downward, which helps add some length to your facial features. On the other hand, spread collars point more to the sides, which helps spread out your features instead of lengthening them. [17] X Research source

steps.title: The classic fit accommodates many different sizes and builds.
steps.content: The classic fit accommodates many different sizes and builds. If you’re looking for a safe, comfortably-fitting shirt, then a classic fit could be a great option for you. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Unlike the classic fit, the slim fit offers much thinner sleeves.
steps.content: Unlike the classic fit, the slim fit offers much thinner sleeves. It also has a slimmer waist, chest, and seat. This type of dress shirt may not be comfortable for every body type—but if you really like this style, can you can always order a custom fit shirt. [19] X Research source If the slim fit doesn’t fit comfortably at first, ask a tailor or specialty shop to extend the fabric around the back.

steps.title: Modern fit shirts offer a nice compromise.
steps.content: Modern fit shirts offer a nice compromise. You get larger armholes while also boasting a slim waist, chest, and seat section. If you find the classic fit too roomy and the slim fit too constrictive, a modern fit shirt might be the perfect match for you. [20] X Research source

steps.title: Hold up the dress shirt to your chest and see how long it falls.
steps.content: Hold up the dress shirt to your chest and see how long it falls. Save the garment for fancier occasions if the hem falls below your hips. [21] X Research source

steps.title: Measure how far the shirt goes down your chest.
steps.content: Measure how far the shirt goes down your chest. If the garment stops along your hips, save the shirt for more casual, relaxed looks. [22] X Research source

steps.title: Undershirts are handy to wear in all seasons.
steps.content: Undershirts are handy to wear in all seasons. In warmer weather, undershirts help protect your dress shirt from unwanted sweat splotches. In the winter, an undershirt keeps you extra toasty and insulated. [23] X Research source Undershirts also give you a bit of freedom if you choose to leave your shirt unbuttoned.
